page.title: 15"Memories"Dunchurch,Rugby
page.content: Mr.Percy Barnwell of{Dunchurch}aged 82 on 7th June 1985 gave us some information about{Dunchurch}when he was a boy. Before the 1st World War{Dunchurch} was a peaceful,friendly village,but after the 1st World War more crime was committed and because of this a jail was built,later to be knocked down. During the 2nd World War,one bomb and a large land mine caused damage in the area and at least one man was killed. { Dunchurch}had three stables,two of which hired out horses and one which was private.The stables were behind the Dun Cow Inn and the Green Man Inn. The Dun Cow Inn was used as a staging post. Before the advent of the railway {Dunchurch}was more important than Rugby.The positioning of the stations changed this.
